summary: Gives NPCs their own weapons and armor instead of the default ones.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][i]*I created a second mod that can be used alongside this one: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88857?]Armor Mod Integration[/url][/i][/size]

[size=4][i]*Getting permission from other mod authors has been slower than expected. I will probably add more at some point in the future, but don't expect regular updates.[/i][/size]

[size=4][i]*Most of these will work in special edition, although the required armor mod may need converted with NIF optimizer. I plan on making something similar for special edition eventually, but am procrastinating on purpose so that other mod authors have more time to create and convert mods.[/i][/size]

[size=5][b][u]Introduction[/u][/b][/size]

There are a lot of great armor mods on the Nexus. However, since my character can only equip one set at a time, I find that most armor just ends up cluttering my crafting menu instead of improving my game experience. This mod is intended to remedy that by making armors added by other mods the default outfits for NPCs.

I didn't just want to do a generic replacer, because it doesn't look right when everybody is walking around in identical sets of the same legendary armor. Instead, everything is individually placed on specific characters.

All modules require you to download the mod from the original author. Please remember to endorse their work.
Rather than just adding the armor to the NPCs, this mod works by creating a brand new item set from the same meshes/textures.
This mean that if you want, you can disable the original mod's ESP file. If you do, you can only obtain the unique set by getting it from the NPC in game.
Some items are placed on essential NPCs, meaning that not all of them will be obtainable.
Sometimes weapons are added in addition to the armor. You can often pickpocket these weapons if your skill is high enough.


[size=5][b][u]Compatibility[/u][/b][/size]

These were only tested with UNP meshes/textures, but should work with other body types.
In order to achieve maximum compatibility, this mod uses a very lightweight script.
When you start a new game, the script will run exactly once, and swaps out the NPC's items with new ones.
This means it should work with nearly all NPC overhauls, although some may have hair clipping.
If the NPC already had its own outfit, I just overrode the outfit instead of creating a script, so you should install this last just in case.

How good some of these sets look depends heavily on which ENB and NPC overhaul mods you are using.


[size=5][b][u]Modular Version[/u][/b] [/size]

There is a modular version containing a separate file for each individual NPC. Just disable the ESPs for the ones you don't want.
Once you have decided which ones you are keeping, I highly recommend using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37981/?]Merge Plugins xEdit Script[/url].
When I run the script, I also load [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34093/?]Weapons and Armor Fixes Remade[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43053/?]Clothing and Clutter Fixes[/url] into TES5Edit (but don't merge them), just so that the script is able to recognize the keywords without throwing errors.


[size=5][b][u]Requirements[/u][/b][/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36213/?]HDT HighHeels System[/url] is a hard requirement for some modules. I always went with the HDT version of a mod unless it specifies otherwise.

If you disable the ESP for a source mod, then you will need to unpack the BSA with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4804/?]BSA Unpacker[/url].

All of the following are soft requirements; it will still work without them. However, I balanced the new armor sets to have stats consistent with these mods.
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/?]Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34093/?]Weapons and Armor Fixes Remade[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43053/?]Clothing and Clutter Fixes[/url]

If you want to obtain the new sets, I also recommend any mod that allows you to remove items from followers.


[size=5][b][u]Installation[/u][/b][/size]

1) Download all armor mods you want from the page by the original author.
2) Download this mod.
3) Deactivate the ESP files you don't want.
4) Extract the BSA file for any source mod you disabled the ESP for.


[size=5][b][u]Main Download[/u][/b][/size]
[i]*the ESP files and scripts for the following are included in the main download file (you need to get the meshes and textures from the link provided)
*some NPCs may have multiple outfits available - only select one[/i]

[size=4]Aela the Huntress ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53494/?]Wild Huntress[/url] ~ Clothing[/size] [i](only works with the non-HDT version)[/i]
[size=4]Ahlam ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61013/?]Emfy Cleric Robes[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Aicantar ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6684/?]Dwarven Mage Robes[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Dwarven)[/size]
[size=4]Angi ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57909/?]Sotteta Huntress[/url] ~ Light Armor (Leather)[/size]
[size=4]Anoriath ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37289/?]Bosmer Armor Pack[/url] ~ Light Armor (Elven)[/size]
[size=4]Beleval ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56998/?]Gwelda Dawnguard[/url] ~ Light Armor (Dawnguard)[/size]
[size=4]Birna ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38053/?]Northgirl[/url] ~ Clothing[/size] [i](default color)[/i]
[size=4]Bolgeir Bearclaw ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77315/?]Resplendent Armor[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Ebony)[/size]
[size=4]Calcelmo ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6684/?]Dwarven Mage Robes[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Dwarven)[/size]
[size=4]Calder ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80642/?]Talos Housecarl Armor Pack[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Nordic)[/size]
[size=4]Colette Marence ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71215/?]Fancy Witch Armour[/url] ~ Clothing (Fortify Restoration)[/size] [i](the hat might cause clipping with some hairstyles)[/i]
[size=4]Dinya Balu ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61013/?]Emfy Cleric Robes[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Faendal ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37289/?]Bosmer Armor Pack[/url] ~ Light Armor (Elven)[/size]
[size=4]Faleen ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53442]zzjay's wardrobe[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Steel Plate)[/size]
[size=4]Faralda ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69681/?]Battlemage Armour[/url] ~ Clothing (Fortify Destruction)[/size] [i](the hat might cause clipping with some hairstyles)[/i]
[size=4]Faralda ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68653/?]Cassandra Frost Witch[/url] ~ Clothing (Fortify Destruction)[/size] [i](the hat might cause clipping with some hairstyles)[/i]
[size=4]Grelka ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77615/]Adventurers Mashup Compilation[/url] ~ Light Armor (Leather)[/size]
[size=4]Hermir ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38053/?]Northgirl[/url] ~ Clothing[/size] [i](chain version)[/i]
[size=4]Illia ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56998/?]Gwelda Witch[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Jenassa ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60195/?]Merta Assassin[/url] ~ Light Armor (Elven)[/size]
[size=4]Mirabelle Ervine ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69007/?]Yennefer Outfit[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Mjoll ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77615/]Adventurers Mashup Compilation[/url] ~ Heavy Armor (Steel)[/size]
[size=4]Nilsine ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38053/?]Northgirl[/url] ~ Clothing[/size] [i](red version)[/i]
[size=4]Nirya ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/66967/]Merta Black Rose[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Sapphire ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59451/?]Tembtra Thief[/url] ~ Light Armor (Thieves Guild)[/size]
[size=4]Serana ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69488/?]Vampire Chain Cuirass[/url] ~ Light Armor (Royal Vampire)[/size]
[size=4]Silvia ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56998/?]Gwelda Witch[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Sybille Stentor ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56998/?]Gwelda Vampire[/url] ~ Clothing[/size]
[size=4]Tonilia ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59451/?]Tembtra Thief[/url] ~ Light Armor (Thieves Guild)[/size]
[size=4]Unmid Snow-Shod ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58656/?]Noldor Content Pack[/url] ~ Light Armor (Elven)[/size]
[size=4]Vex ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59451/?]Tembtra Thief[/url] ~ Light Armor (Thieves Guild)[/size]
[size=4]Wylandriah ~ [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69681/?]Battlemage Armour[/url] ~ Clothing[/size] [i](the hat might cause clipping with some hairstyles)[/i]


[size=5][b][u]Answers to Common Questions[/u][/b][/size]

I realize that the number of ESP files has gotten large. I will make some bundles at some point in the future for those of you who don't want to run the merge plugins script. The are several reasons this isn't just one large all-in-one file.

1) Different people want very different things. For example, some people want this to have no skimpy armor, while others want this to be only skimpy armor. Having a fully modular version maximizes the amout of choice each user has in deciding how they want their game to be.

2) This already requires a ton of other mods to be downloaded as a prerequisite, and is going to require even more in the future. I don't want the whole project to be unusable because one file becomes unavailable. Body types also come into play here. For example, some of these mods support UNP and CBBE, while others only support UNP. I don't want to alienate all CBBE users because they can't use the UNP mods.

3) I do not currently have a specific end product in mind. Keeping everything optional allows me to keep producing additional mods without constantly needing to stop and reevaluate whether the next new part being added is going to work well with the rest of the mod.


[size=5][b][u]Other Mods Used in Screenshots[/u][/b][/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79335/?]Snowfall Weathers ENB[/url]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72626/?]Bijin All in One[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82131/?]Serana and Claire[/url]
author: Aerathmir
